meanings.definition: The belief in or expectation of an imminent end of the world.
meanings.sent1: Her apocalyptism led her to prepare for the end times by stocking up on supplies.
meanings.sent2: Many ancient civilizations had their own versions of apocalyptism predicting the world's end.
meanings.sent3: Despite his apocalyptism, John couldn't resist making plans for his birthday next year.
meanings.sent4: The movie depicted a world ravaged by apocalyptism, where only a few survivors remained.
meanings.sent5: The preacher's vivid apocalyptism painted a terrifying picture of the world's final days.

meanings.definition: A system of religious beliefs concerning the ultimate destiny of humanity.
meanings.sent1: Their apocalyptism included prophecies about the afterlife and judgment day.
meanings.sent2: The ancient texts revealed the intricate details of their apocalyptism.
meanings.sent3: The group's apocalyptism made them believe they were chosen for a special mission.
meanings.sent4: In their apocalyptism, the followers awaited the arrival of a chosen savior.
meanings.sent5: The apocalyptism of the cult followers shaped their daily rituals and prayers.

meanings.definition: A catastrophic event or series of events.
meanings.sent1: The earthquake was a true apocalyptism, leaving the city in ruins.
meanings.sent2: The apocalyptism of the hurricane brought widespread destruction to the coastal town.
meanings.sent3: The sudden power outage felt like a minor apocalyptism in the office.
meanings.sent4: The apocalyptism of the volcanic eruption covered the sky in ash and darkness.
meanings.sent5: The apocalyptism of the meteor strike changed life on Earth forever.
